Anchors.Left.name: Anchors.Left

Anchors.LeftMiddle.name: Anchors.LeftMiddle

Anchors.Right.name: Anchors.Right
Anchors.Right.description: An Anchor that is located at the right middle of the element.

Anchors.RightMiddle.name: Anchors.RightMiddle

Anchors.Center.name: Anchors.Center
Anchors.Center.description: An Anchor that is located at the center of the element.

Anchors.TopRight.name: Anchors.TopRight
Anchors.TopRight.description: An Anchor that is located at the top right corner of the element.

Anchors.BottomRight.name: Anchors.BottomRight
Anchors.BottomRight.description: An Anchor that is located at the bottom right corner of the element.

Anchors.TopLeft.name: Anchors.TopLeft

Anchors.BottomLeft.name: Anchors.BottomLeft
Anchors.BottomLeft.description: An Anchor that is located at the bottom left corner of the element.

Anchors.AutoDefault.name: Anchors.AutoDefault
Anchors.AutoDefault.description: Default DynamicAnchors - chooses from Top, Right, Bottom, Left.

Anchors.Assign.name: Anchors.Assign
Anchors.Assign.description:
An Anchor whose location is assigned at connection time, through an AnchorPositionFinder. Used in conjunction
with the `makeTarget` function. jsPlumb has two of these - `Fixed` and `Grid`, and you can also write your own.

Anchors.ContinuousLeft.name: Anchors.ContinuousLeft
Anchors.ContinuousLeft.description: A continuous anchor that uses only the left edge of the element.

Anchors.ContinuousTop.name: Anchors.ContinuousTop
Anchors.ContinuousTop.description: A continuous anchor that uses only the top edge of the element.

Anchors.ContinuousBottom.name: Anchors.ContinuousBottom
Anchors.ContinuousBottom.description: A continuous anchor that uses only the bottom edge of the element.

Anchors.ContinuousRight.name: Anchors.ContinuousRight
Anchors.ContinuousRight.description: A continuous anchor that uses only the right edge of the element.

Anchors.Continuous.name: Anchors.Continuous
Anchors.Continuous.description: An Anchor that tracks the other element in the connection, choosing the closest face.

params.name: params
params.description: Constructor parameters

props.name: faces
props.description: Optional array of faces for the anchor. Valid values are `"top"`, `"left"`, `"bottom"` and `"right"`.

Anchors.Perimeter.name: Anchors.Perimeter
Anchors.Perimeter.description:
An Anchor that tracks the perimeter of some shape, approximating it with a given number of dynamically
positioned locations.

params.name: params
params.description: Constructor parameters

props.name: anchorCount
props.description: Optional number of anchors to use to approximate the perimeter. default is 60.

props.name: shape
props.description: Required. the name of the shape. Valid values are 'rectangle', 'square', 'ellipse', 'circle', 'triangle' and 'diamond'

props.name: rotation
props.description: Optional rotation, in degrees, to apply.

Connection.name: Connection
Connection.description:
Models a Connection.  A Connection consists of two Endpoints (each of which belongs to some DOM element), a Connector (the actual path inscribed by the
Connection), and zero or more Overlays.

Connector.name: Connector
Connector.description:
Parent for all Connector types. When you provide a Connector definition to an appropriate jsPlumb method,
you can do so either as a `String`, or as an Array of the form `[String, Object]`.  In the former case, the String
must be one of the members from this namespace, such as `"Bezier"` or `"StateMachine"`. In the latter case,
the first argument to the array is the Connector name, and the second is a JS object containing 
constructor parameters for the Connector, for instance


   `[ "Bezier", { curviness:75 } ]`


Each Connector type supports its own set of parameters, with some parameters (such as stub) being shared by most.

params.name: params
params.description: Constructor parameters

props.name: stub
props.description:
Minimum length for the stub at each end of the connector. This can be an integer, giving a value for both ends of the connections, 
or an array of two integers, giving separate values for each end.

props.name: gap
props.description:
Gap to leave between the end of the connector and the element on which the endpoint resides. if you make this larger than stub then you will see some odd looking behaviour.  
          Like stub, this can be an array or a single value.

props.name: cornerRadius
props.description: Optional, defines the radius of corners between segments. Defaults to 0 (hard edged corners).

props.name: alwaysRespectStubs
props.description:
Whether or not the connectors should always draw the stub, or, if the two elements
                      are in close proximity to each other (closer than the sum of the two stubs), to adjust the stubs.

props.name: midpoint
props.description: If provided, jsPlumb will use this location as the midpoint of the connector.

Connectors.StateMachine.name: Connectors.StateMachine
Connectors.StateMachine.description: Provides "state machine" connectors. These are a quadratic bezier curve.

params.name: params
params.description: Constructor parameters.

props.name: curviness
props.description:
Measure of how "curvy" the connectors will be.  this is translated as the distance that the
               Bezier curve's control point is from the midpoint of the straight line connecting the two
             endpoints, and does not mean that the connector is this wide.  The Bezier curve never reaches
             its control points; they act as gravitational masses.

props.name: margin
props.description: Distance from element to start and end connectors, in pixels.

props.name: proximityLimit
props.description:
Sets the distance beneath which the elements are consider too close together to bother
           with fancy curves.

props.name: loopbackRadius
props.description: The radius of a loopback connector.

props.name: showLoopback
props.description: If set to false this tells the connector that it is ok to paint connections whose source and target is the same element with a connector running through the element. The default value for this is true; the connector always makes a loopback connection loop around the element rather than passing through it.

props.name: orientation
props.description: Valid values are `"clockwise"` and `"anticlockwise"`. Indicates in which direction a loopback connection should be considered to be travelling.

Connectors.Straight.name: Connectors.Straight
Connectors.Straight.description: The Straight connector draws a simple straight line between the two anchor points.

params.name: params
params.description: Constructor parameters.

props.name: stub
props.description: Optional distance to travel from each endpoint before making the connection between the two.

props.name: sourceStub
props.description: Optional stub for the source endpoint only.

props.name: targetStub
props.description: Optional stub for the target endpoint only.

props.name: gap
props.description: Optional gap to leave between the endpoints and the start of the connector.

props.name: sourceGap
props.description: Optional gap for the source endpoint only.

props.name: targetGap
props.description: Optional gap for the target endpoint only.

Connectors.Bezier.name: Connectors.Bezier
Connectors.Bezier.description:
This Connector draws a Bezier curve with two control points.  You can provide a 'curviness' value which gets applied to jsPlumb's
internal voodoo machine and ends up generating locations for the two control points.

params.name: params
params.description: Constructor parameters.

props.name: curviness
props.description:
How 'curvy' you want the curve to be! This is a directive for the placement of control points, not endpoints of the curve, so your curve does not 
actually touch the given point, but it has the tendency to lean towards it.  The larger this value, the greater the curve is pulled from a straight line.

props.name: stub
props.description: Optional value for a distance to travel from the connector's endpoint before beginning the Bezier curve.

Endpoint.name: Endpoint
Endpoint.description:
Models an Endpoint - one end of a Connection. An Endpoint has an underlying Anchor, which is what determines the
Endpoint's position. Each Endpoint can have 1 to `maxConnections` connections emanating from it (set `maxConnections` to -1 
to allow unlimited Connections; the default is 1).

You never need to create an Endpoint directly. When you provide an Endpoint definition to an appropriate 
jsPlumb method, you can do so either as a string, or as an array of the form `[String, Object]`.  In the former case, the string
must be the name of some available Endpoint, such as `"Dot"` or `"Rectangle"`. In the latter case,
the first argument to the array is the Endpoint name, and the second is a JS object containing 
constructor parameters for the Endpoint, for instance

   `[ "Dot", { radius:75 } ]`

params.name: params
params.description: Constructor parameters.

props.name: anchor
props.description: Definition of the Anchor for the endpoint.  See the jsPlumb documentation for a discussion of this.

props.name: endpoint
props.description: Endpoint definition. See the jsPlumb documentation for a discussion of this.

props.name: enabled
props.description: Whether or not the Endpoint should be enabled for mouse events (drag/drop).

props.name: paintStyle
props.description: Endpoint style, a js object. may be null.

props.name: hoverPaintStyle
props.description: Style to use when the mouse is hovering over the Endpoint. A js object. may be null; defaults to null.

props.name: cssClass
props.description: CSS class to set on the display element associated with this Endpoint.

props.name: hoverClass
props.description: CSS class to set on the display element associated with this Endpoint when it is in hover state.

props.name: source
props.description: Element the Endpoint is attached to, of type String (an element id), element selector, or element. Required.

props.name: container
props.description: Id or selector instructing jsPlumb where to attach the element it creates for this endpoint.  you should read the documentation for a full discussion of this.

props.name: connections
props.description: List of Connections to configure the Endpoint with.

props.name: isSource
props.description: Indicates the endpoint can act as a source of new connections. Optional; defaults to false.

props.name: maxConnections
props.description: A value of -1 means no upper limit.

props.name: dragOptions
props.description: If `isSource` is set to true, you can supply arguments for the underlying library's drag method. Optional; defaults to null.

props.name: connectorStyle
props.description: If `isSource` is set to true, this is the paint style for Connections from this Endpoint. Optional; defaults to null.

props.name: connectorHoverStyle
props.description: If `isSource` is set to true, this is the hover paint style for Connections from this Endpoint. Optional; defaults to null.

props.name: connector
props.description: Connector type to use.  Like `endpoint`, this may be either a single string nominating a known Connector type (eg. `"Bezier"`, `"Straight"`), or an array containing [name, params], eg. `[ "Bezier", { curviness:160 } ]`.

props.name: connectorOverlays
props.description: Array of Overlay definitions that will be applied to any Connection from this Endpoint.

props.name: connectorClass
props.description: CSS class to set on Connections emanating from this Endpoint.

props.name: connectorHoverClass
props.description: CSS class to set on to set on Connections emanating from this Endpoint when they are in hover state.

props.name: connectionsDetachable
props.description: Sets whether connections to/from this Endpoint should be detachable or not.

props.name: isTarget
props.description: Indicates the endpoint can act as a target of new connections. Optional; defaults to false.

props.name: dropOptions
props.description: If `isTarget` is set to true, you can supply arguments for the underlying library's drop method with this parameter. Optional; defaults to null.

props.name: reattach
props.description: Determines whether or not the Connections reattach after they have been dragged off an Endpoint and left floating. defaults to false: Connections dropped in this way will just be deleted.

props.name: parameters
props.description: JS object containing parameters to set on the Endpoint. These parameters are then available via the getParameter method.  When a connection is made involving this Endpoint, the parameters from this Endpoint are copied into that Connection. Source Endpoint parameters override target Endpoint parameters if they both have a parameter with the same name.

props.name: connector-pointer-events
props.description: A value for the 'pointer-events' property of any SVG elements that are created to render connections from this endoint.

props.name: connectionType
props.description: Optional descriptor for the `type` of connections this endpoint is a source for. Used when dragging new connections.

props.name: dragProxy
props.description: Optional endpoint definition for the endpoint to use as the drag endpoint when dragging a new connection. If you provide this it will override any other means of determining what the drag endpoint should look like.

Endpoints.Blank.name: Endpoints.Blank
Endpoints.Blank.description: Does not draw anything visible to the user. This Endpoint is probably not what you want if you need your users to be able to drag existing Connections - for that, use a Rectangle or Dot Endpoint and assign to it a CSS class that causes it to be transparent.

Endpoints.Dot.name: Endpoints.Dot
Endpoints.Dot.description: A circular Endpoint with configurable radius.

params.name: params
params.description: Constructor parameters

props.name: radius
props.description: Radius of the Endpoint

props.name: cssClass
props.description: Optional space-delimited list of CSS classes to attach to the Endpoint.

props.name: hoverClass
props.description: Optional space-delimited list of CSS classes to attach to the Endpoint when the mouse is hovering over it.

Endpoints.Rectangle.name: Endpoints.Rectangle
Endpoints.Rectangle.description: A rectangular Endpoint with configurable width/height.

params.name: params
params.description: Constructor parameters

props.name: width
props.description: Width of the Endpoint

props.name: height
props.description: Height of the Endpoint

props.name: cssClass
props.description: Optional space-delimited list of CSS classes to attach to the Endpoint.

props.name: hoverClass
props.description: Optional space-delimited list of CSS classes to attach to the Endpoint when the mouse is hovering over it.

Endpoints.Image.name: Endpoints.Image
Endpoints.Image.description: An Endpoint that uses an Image.

params.name: params
params.description: Constructor parameters

props.name: src
props.description: Url of the image to display

props.name: cssClass
props.description: Optional space-delimited list of CSS classes to attach to the Endpoint.

props.name: hoverClass
props.description: Optional space-delimited list of CSS classes to attach to the Endpoint when the mouse is hovering over it.

jsPlumb.name: jsPlumb
jsPlumb.description:
This is a static jsPlumbInstance that is created and registered on the window, really just for the sake of convenience:  you do not have to use this; you can create your own instances using
the `jsPlumbInstance.getInstance` method. For a list of the available methods and properties on this object,
see the `jsPlumbInstance` API docs.

jsPlumbInstance.name: jsPlumbInstance
jsPlumbInstance.description:
This class models an instance of jsPlumb.  The global object {{#crossLink "jsPlumb"}}{{/crossLink}} is both a static module
and an instance of this class, and it is an instance of this class that is returned from {{#crossLink "jsPlumb"}}{{/crossLink}}.
A jsPlumbInstance manages a set of Endpoints and Connections.

OverlayCapableJsPlumbUIComponent.name: OverlayCapableJsPlumbUIComponent
OverlayCapableJsPlumbUIComponent.description: Base class for components that support Overlays. This class should never be directly instantiated.

AbstractOverlay.name: AbstractOverlay
AbstractOverlay.description:
Parent for all Overlay types.  The core concept with an Overlay is that of its `location`, which is specified
as follows:

###### Connectors
    - a value between 0 and 1 inclusive is a proportional value, relative to the length of the Connector's path.
    - a value greater than 1 or less than 0 is an absolute value (travel along the path inscribed by the Connector)

For Connectors, the default value is `0.5`.

###### Endpoints
    - An array of two values which are proportional to the width and height of the Endpoint.

For Endpoints, the default value is `[0.5, 0.5]`.

Overlays.Arrow.name: Overlays.Arrow
Overlays.Arrow.description: Draws an arrow, using four points: the head and two tail points, and a `foldback` point, which permits the tail of the arrow to be indented.

params.name: params
params.description: Constructor parameters

props.name: width
props.description: Width of the tail of the arrow

props.name: length
props.description: Distance from the tail of the arrow to the head

props.name: location
props.description: Where, either as a proportional value from 0 to 1 inclusive, or as an absolute value (negative values mean distance from target; positive values greater than 1 mean distance from source) the Arrow should appear on the Connector

props.name: direction
props.description: Which way to point. Allowed values are 1 (the default, meaning forwards) and -1, meaning backwards

props.name: foldback
props.description: How far along the axis of the arrow the tail points foldback in to.

props.name: paintStyle
props.description: A style object in the form used for paintStyle values for Endpoints and Connectors.

Overlays.PlainArrow.name: Overlays.PlainArrow
Overlays.PlainArrow.description: This is just a specialized instance of Arrow in which jsPlumb hardcodes `foldback` to 1, meaning the tail of the Arrow is a flat edge

params.name: params
params.description: Constructor parameters

props.name: width
props.description: Width of the tail of the arrow

props.name: length
props.description: Distance from the tail of the arrow to the head

props.name: location
props.description: Where, either as a proportional value from 0 to 1 inclusive, or as an absolute value (negative values mean distance from target; positive values greater than 1 mean distance from source) the PlainArrow should appear on the Connector

props.name: direction
props.description: Which way to point. Allowed values are 1 (the default, meaning forwards) and -1, meaning backwards

props.name: paintStyle
props.description: A style object in the form used for paintStyle values for Endpoints and Connectors.

Overlays.Diamond.name: Overlays.Diamond
Overlays.Diamond.description: This is a specialized instance of Arrow in which jsPlumb hardcodes `foldback` to 2, meaning the Arrow turns into a Diamond

params.name: params
params.description: Constructor parameters

props.name: width
props.description: Width of the diamond.

props.name: length
props.description: Length of the diamond.

props.name: location
props.description: Where, either as a proportional value from 0 to 1 inclusive, or as an absolute value (negative values mean distance from target; positive values greater than 1 mean distance from source) the Diamond should appear on the Connector

props.name: paintStyle
props.description: A style object in the form used for paintStyle values for Endpoints and Connectors.

Overlays.Label.name: Overlays.Label
Overlays.Label.description:
Provides a text label with which to decorate Connectors or Endpoints. jsPlumb draws a Label overlay as a styled DIV.  You can style a Label
using the `cssClass` parameter, or - if you need to programmatically generate the appearance - the `labelStyle` parameter.

params.name: params
params.description: Constructor parameters

params.name: label
params.description: - The text to display. You can provide a function here instead of plain text: it is passed the component as an argument, and it should return a String.

params.name: cssClass
params.description: Optional css class to use for the Label.

params.name: location
params.description: Where, either as a proportional value from 0 to 1 inclusive, or as an absolute value (negative values mean distance from target; positive values greater than 1 mean distance from source) the Label should appear on the Connector

params.name: labelStyle
params.description: Optional object containing properties for the label's style. Use this if you need to prgrammatically generate the label's appearance.

props.name: cssClass
props.description: css class for the label (you can also use the `cssClass` parameter on the label; this exists for historical reasons)

props.name: font
props.description: A string specifying a font to use, in valid CSS format.

props.name: color
props.description: A string specifying a font color to use, in valid CSS format.

props.name: fill
props.description: A string specifying the background for the label, in valid CSS format.

props.name: borderStyle
props.description: A string specifying the border color for the label, in valid CSS format.

props.name: borderWidth
props.description: Width of the border's label

props.name: padding
props.description: Padding for the label.

jsPlumbUIComponent.name: jsPlumbUIComponent
jsPlumbUIComponent.description:
Abstract superclass for Endpoint, Connection, Connector and Overlay.
This class provides support for a few basic capabilities that are common to many objects in jsPlumb:

- Events
- Types
- CSS Classes
- Parameters
- Paint Styles

You don't interact directly with an instance of this class; it is abstract.

jsPlumbUtil.name: jsPlumbUtil
jsPlumbUtil.description: A set of helper methods for use by jsPlumb.

classitems.description:
Connection constructor. You should not ever create one of these directly. If you make a call to jsPlumb.connect, all of
the parameters that you pass in to that function will be passed to the Connection constructor; if your UI
uses the various Endpoint-centric methods like addEndpoint/makeSource/makeTarget, along with drag and drop,
then the parameters you set on those functions are translated and passed in to the Connection constructor. So
you should check the documentation for each of those methods.

params.name: params
params.description: Constructor parameters

props.name: source
props.description: Either an element id, a selector for an element, or an Endpoint.

props.name: target
props.description: Either an element id, a selector for an element, or an Endpoint

props.name: scope
props.description: Scope descriptor for this connection.

props.name: container
props.description: Optional id, element or selector instructing jsPlumb where to attach all the elements it creates for this connection.  you should read the documentation for a full discussion of this.

props.name: detachable
props.description: Defines whether or not the connection may be detached using the mouse.

props.name: reattach
props.description: Defines whether not the connection should be retached if it was dragged off an Endpoint and then dropped in whitespace.

props.name: endpoint
props.description: Optional Endpoint definition to use for both ends of the connection.

props.name: endpoints
props.description: Optional array of two Endpoint definitions, one for each end of the Connection. This and 'endpoint' are mutually exclusive parameters.

props.name: endpointStyle
props.description: Endpoint style definition to use for both ends of the Connection.

props.name: endpointStyles
props.description: Array of two Endpoint style definitions, one for each end of the Connection. This and 'endpoint' are mutually exclusive parameters.

props.name: paintStyle
props.description: Parameters defining the appearance of the Connection. Optional; jsPlumb will use the defaults if you supply nothing here.

props.name: hoverPaintStyle
props.description: Parameters defining the appearance of the Connection when the mouse is hovering over it. Optional; jsPlumb will use the defaults if you supply nothing here (note that the default hoverPaintStyle is null).

props.name: cssClass
props.description: CSS class to set on the display element associated with this Connection.

props.name: hoverClass
props.description: CSS class to set on the display element associated with this Connection when it is in hover state.

props.name: overlays
props.description: Array of Overlay definitions to appear on this Connection.

props.name: drawEndpoints
props.description: If false, instructs jsPlumb to not draw the endpoints for this Connection.  Be careful with this: it only really works when you tell jsPlumb to attach elements to the document body. Read the documentation for a full discussion of this.

props.name: parameters
props.description: JS object containing parameters to set on the Connection. These parameters are then available via the getParameter method.

classitems.description: ID of the source element.
classitems.name: sourceId

classitems.description: ID of the target element.
classitems.name: targetId

classitems.description: Scope descriptor for the Connection.
classitems.name: scope

classitems.description: Source element in the Connection.
classitems.name: source

classitems.description: Target element in the Connection.
classitems.name: target

classitems.description: Array of Endpoints.
classitems.name: endpoints

classitems.description: Gets the underlying Connector for this Connection. A Connector is the path the user sees between the two Endpoints.
classitems.name: getConnector

return.description: The current Connector.

classitems.description:
Returns whether or not this Connection can be detached from its target/source endpoint.  By default this
is false; use it in conjunction with the `reattach` parameter.
classitems.name: isDetachable

return.description: True if can be detached, false otherwise.

classitems.description: Returns whether or not the Connection is editable.
classitems.name: isEditable

return.description: True if editable, false if not.

classitems.description:
Returns whether or not this Connection will be reattached after having been detached via the mouse and dropped.  By default this
is false; use it in conjunction with the `detachable` parameter.
classitems.name: isReattach

return.description: True if will reattach, false if not.

classitems.description: Returns whether or not the Connection is currently visible.
classitems.name: isVisible

return.description: True if visible, false if not.

classitems.description:
Sets the Connection's connector (eg `Bezier`, `Flowchart`, etc).  You pass a Connector definition into this method, the same
thing that you would set as the `connector` property on a `jsPlumb.connect` call.
classitems.name: setConnector

params.name: connector
params.description: Connector definition. See jsPlumb documentation for a discussion.

classitems.description: Sets whether or not this connection is detachable.
classitems.name: setDetachable

params.name: detachable
params.description: Whether or not to set the Connection to be detachable.

classitems.description:
Sets whether or not the Connection is editable. This will only be honoured if
the underlying Connector is editable - not all types are.
classitems.name: setEditable

params.name: editable
params.description: Whether or not to set the Connection to be editable.

classitems.description: Sets whether or not this connection will reattach after having been detached via the mouse and dropped.
classitems.name: setReattach

params.name: reattach
params.description: Whether or not to set the Connection to reattach after it has been dropped in whitespace.

classitems.description: Sets whether or not the Connection should be visible.
classitems.name: setVisible

params.name: visible
params.description: Boolean indicating desired visible state.

classitems.description: Returns the data provided (if any) to this object for populating its types.
classitems.name: getData

return.description: Data, or null.

classitems.description: Gets the UUIDs of the two endpoints, if they are set.
classitems.name: getUuids

return.description: An array of [sourceUuid, targetUuid]. Either or both of these values may be null.

classitems.description: The Connector's associated DOM element.
classitems.name: canvas

classitems.description: Gets the total length of the path inscribed by the connector, in pixels.
classitems.name: getLength

return.description: Total length of path in pixels.

classitems.description: Gets the path inscribed by the connector, as a series of [x,y] points.
classitems.name: getPath

return.description: An array of [x,y] locations.

classitems.description: The Endpoint's drawing area
classitems.name: canvas

classitems.description: Optional spec for the endpoint to use when dragging a new connection
classitems.name: dragProxy

classitems.description: List of Connections for the Endpoint.
classitems.name: connections

classitems.description: Scope descriptor for the Endpoint.
classitems.name: scope

classitems.description:
Sets the anchor to use for this Endpoint.  `anchorParams` is an object in the same
form that you would pass as the `anchor` parameter to `jsPlumb.addEndpoint` or `jsPlumb.connect`.
classitems.name: setAnchor

params.name: anchorParams
params.description: Parameters for the anchor

params.name: [doNotRepaint
params.description: = false] Instructs jsPlumb to not repaint after setting the new anchor.

return.description: The Endpoint.

classitems.description:
Sets the underlying visual representation to use for this Endpoint.  `ep` is an object in the same
form that you would pass as the `endpoint` parameter to `jsPlumb.addEndpoint` or `jsPlumb.makeSource`.
classitems.name: setEndpoint

params.name: ep
params.description: Parameters for the endpoint

classitems.description: Detach from the given Connection, without cleaning up or destroying the Connection.
classitems.name: detachFromConnection

classitems.description: Detach and cleanup a connection.
classitems.name: detach

classitems.description: Detach all connections for this endpoint.
classitems.name: detachAll

params.name: fireEvent
params.description: Whether or not to fire an event for each detach.

params.name: forceDetach
params.description: If true, this call will ignore any `beforeDetach` interceptors.

Sets the current element to use as the Container for the given jsPlumbInstance - the element that will be the parent for
all artefacts added by jsPlumb. By default, the Container is set to the offsetParent of the first element on which 
`connect`, `addEndpoint`, `makeSource` or `makeTarget` is called, but you are encouraged to set a Container either in the
arguments to the `jsPlumb.newInstance(...)` method, or via `jsPlumbInstance.importDefaults`.

classitems.description: Adds an Endpoint to a given element or elements. See also `jsPlumbInstance.addEndpoints`.

params.name: el

params.name: referenceParams
params.description:
Object containing more Endpoint constructor arguments; it will be merged with params by jsPlumb.  You would use this if you had some 
shared parameters that you wanted to reuse when you added Endpoints to a number of elements. The allowed values in this object are anything that 'params' can contain.  See <Endpoint>.

params.name: referenceParams
params.description: Object containing more Endpoint constructor arguments; it will be merged with params by jsPlumb.  You would use this if you had some shared parameters that you wanted to reuse when you added Endpoints to a number of elements.

return.description: List of newly created Endpoints, one for each entry in the `endpoints` argument.

classitems.description: Establishes a {@link Connection} between two elements (or {@link Endpoint}s, which are themselves registered to elements).
classitems.name: connect

params.name: params
params.description: Connection params

props.name: source
props.description: Source of the connection. May be an id, or an element, or an Endpoint.

props.name: target
props.description: Target of the connection. May be an id, or an element, or an Endpoint.

props.name: uuids
props.description: Optional array of UUIDs of the two Endpoints to connect. If you supply this you do not need to supply `source` or `target`.

props.name: type
props.description: Optional type for the Connection.

props.name: pointer-events
props.description: Optional `pointer-events` value for the Connection (only used by the SVG renderer)

props.name: connector
props.description:
The type of Connector to use. Defaults to whatever is set in the defaults for the instance. This
parameter can be either a String - a named Connector, such as "Straight" - or an array consisting of a Connector name plus
constructor parameters. For further information see the main documentation.

params.name: referenceParams
params.description:
Optional second set of parameters, which will be merged into a new object along with `params`. This can be useful if
you have some common settings to share between multiple `connect` calls. Valid values in this object are anything that is valid in `params`.

return.description: The Connection that was created, or null if either the source or target element was not found (in which case the missin element is also logged).

classitems.description:
This is a wrapper around the supporting library's animate function; it injects a call to jsPlumb in the 'step' function (creating
the 'step' function if necessary). This only supports the two-arg version of the animate call in jQuery, the one that takes an 'options' object as
the second arg. MooTools has only one method, a two arg one. Which is handy.  YUI has a one-arg method, so jsPlumb merges 'properties' and 'options' together for YUI.
classitems.name: animate

params.name: el
params.description: Element to animate. Either an id, or a selector representing the element.

params.name: properties
params.description: The 'properties' argument you want passed to the library's animate call.

params.name: options
params.description: The 'options' argument you want passed to the library's animate call.

classitems.description:
Returns the default Endpoint type. Used when someone wants to subclass Endpoint and have jsPlumb return instances of their subclass.
 you would make a call like this in your class's constructor:
 
   `jsPlumb.getDefaultEndpointType().apply(this, arguments);`
classitems.name: getDefaultEndpointType

return.description: The default Endpoint function used by jsPlumb.

classitems.description:
Returns the default Connection type. Used when someone wants to subclass Connection and have jsPlumb return instances of their subclass.
 you would make a call like this in your class's constructor:
 
   `jsPlumb.getDefaultConnectionType().apply(this, arguments);`
classitems.name: getDefaultConnectionType

return.description: The default Connection function used by jsPlumb.

classitems.description: Extends o1 with the properties of o2, optionally filtering via the values in filterList.

params.name: o1
params.description: Object to extend into

params.name: o2
params.description: Object to extend from

params.name: filterList
params.description: Optional list of property names to filter by - if this is provided, only values whose keys are in this list will be copied into o1.

classitems.description:
Gets all or a subset of connections currently managed by this jsPlumb instance.  If only one scope is passed in to this method,
the result will be a list of connections having that scope (passing in no scope at all will result in jsPlumb assuming you want the
default scope).

If multiple scopes are passed in, the return value will be a map of

   `{ scope -> [ connection... ] }`
classitems.name: getConnections

params.name: scope
params.description:
If the first argument supplied to this function is a string, it is treated as a scope filter, and this method will return a list
                 of connections that are in the given scope. use '*' for all scopes.

params.name: options
params.description: Filter options

props.name: scope
props.description: may be a string specifying a single scope, or an array of strings, specifying multiple scopes. Also may have the value '*', indicating any scope.

props.name: source
props.description: either a string representing an element id, a selector, or an array of ids. Also may have the value '*', indicating any source.  Constrains the result to connections having this/these element(s) as source.

props.name: target
props.description: either a string representing an element id, a selector, or an array of ids. Also may have the value '*', indicating any target.  Constrains the result to connections having this/these element(s) as target.

params.name: flat
params.description: return results in a flat array (don't return an object whose keys are scopes and whose values are lists per scope).

return.description: If only one scope was requested, a list of Connections that match the criteria. Otherwise, a map of [scope->connection lists].

classitems.description:
Selects a set of Connections, using the filter options from the getConnections method, and returns an object
that allows you to perform an operation on all of the Connections at once.

The return value from any of these operations is the original list of Connections, allowing operations to be
chained (for 'setter' type operations). 'getter' type operations return an array of values, where each entry is
of the form:

   `[ Connection, return value ]`
classitems.name: select

params.name: params
params.description: Filter parameters. All of the values in this object are optional; if you supply no parameters at all you will get back all of the current Connections in the given jsPlumb instance.

props.name: scope
props.description: scope - see getConnections

props.name: source
props.description: - see getConnections

props.name: target
props.description: - see getConnections

props.name: connections
props.description: - an existing list of Connections.  If you supply this, 'source' and 'target' will be ignored.

return.description:
A list of Connections on which operations may be executed. 'Setter' type operations can be chained; 'getter' type operations
return an array of `[Connection, value]` pairs, one entry for each Connection in the list returned. The full list of operations 
is as follows (where not specified, the operation's effect or return value is the same as the corresponding method on Connection) :
				
- **addClass** : Adds a class to all the Connections in the list.
-	**addOverlay** : Adds an Overlay to all the Connections in the list.
-	**addType** : Adds a type to all the Connections in the list.
-	**delete** : Deletes all the Connections in the list. Not chainable, and does not return anything.
-	**each(function(connection)...)** : Allows you to specify your own function to execute; this function is chainable.		
-	**get(index)** : Returns the Connection at 'index' in the list.			
-	**getHoverPaintStyle**
- **getLabel**
-	**getOverlay**
-	**getPaintStyle**		
-	**getParameter**
-	**getParameters**
-	**getType**
-	**getZIndex**
-	**hasType**		
-	**hideOverlay**
-	**hideOverlays**		
-	**isDetachable**		
-	**isHover**
-	**isReattach**
-	**isVisible**		
-	**length** : returns the length of the list.
-	**removeAllOverlays**		
- **removeClass**
-	**removeOverlay**
-	**removeOverlays**
-	**removeType**
-	**repaint**	
-	**setConnector**		
-	**setDetachable**
-	**setHover**		
-	**setHoverPaintStyle**		
-	**setLabel**		
-	**setPaintStyle**	
-	**setParameter**
-	**setParameters**
- **setReattach**	
-	**setType**	
-	**showOverlay**	
-	**showOverlays**

classitems.description:
Selects a set of Endpoints and returns an object that allows you to execute various different methods on them at once. The return 
value from any of these operations is the original list of Endpoints, allowing operations to be chained (for 'setter' type 
operations). 'getter' type operations return an array of values, where each entry is of the form:

    `[ Endpoint, return value ]`
classitems.name: selectEndpoints

params.name: params
params.description: Filter parameters.

props.name: scope
props.description: Scope(s) to match

props.name: source
props.description: - limits returned endpoints to those that are declared as a source endpoint on any elements identified.

props.name: target
props.description: - limits returned endpoints to those that are declared as a target endpoint on any elements identified.

props.name: element
props.description: - limits returned endpoints to those that are declared as either a source OR a target endpoint on any elements identified.

return.description:
A list of Endpoints on which operations may be executed. 'Setter' type operations can be chained; 'getter' type operations
return an array of `[Endpoint, value]` pairs, one entry for each Endpoint in the list returned. 

The full list of operations is as follows (where not specified, the operation's effect or return value is the
same as the corresponding method on Endpoint) :

-	**setHover**
-	**removeAllOverlays**
-	**setLabel**
- **addClass**
-	**addOverlay**
- **removeClass**
-	**removeOverlay**
-	**removeOverlays**
-	**showOverlay**
-	**hideOverlay**
-	**showOverlays**
-	**hideOverlays**
-	**setPaintStyle**
-	**setHoverPaintStyle**
-	**setParameter**
-	**setParameters**
-	**setAnchor**
- **getLabel**
-	**getOverlay**
-	**isHover**
-	**isDetachable**
-	**getParameter**
-	**getParameters**
-	**getPaintStyle**
-	**getHoverPaintStyle**
-	**deleteEveryConnection** : Deletes all the Connections from every Endpoint in the list. not chainable and does not return anything.
-	**delete** : Deletes every Endpoint in the list. not chainable and does not return anything.		
-	**length** : returns the length of the list.
-	**get(index)** : returns the Endpoint at 'index' in the list.
-	**each(function(endpoint)...)** : allows you to specify your own function to execute; this function is chainable.

classitems.description:
Recalculates the offsets of all child elements of some element. If you have Endpoints registered on the
descendants of some element and you make changes to that element's markup, it is possible that the location
of each Endpooint relative to the origin of the element may have changed. So you call this to tell jsPlumb to
recalculate.  You need to do this because, for performance reasons, jsplumb won't calculate these offsets on
the fly.
classitems.name: recalculateOffsets

params.name: el
params.description: The element for which to recalculate offsets.

will probably be used by very few people; it's good for testing

without having to first register any Endpoints.  When a Connection is established,
the endpoint spec that was passed in to this method is used to create a suitable

props.name: scope
props.description: Scope for the drop zone.

props.name: dropOptions
props.description: Same stuff as you would pass to dropOptions of an Endpoint definition.

props.name: deleteEndpointsOnEmpty
props.description:
Whether or not to delete any Endpoints created by a connection to this target if
the connection is subsequently detached. this will not remove Endpoints that have had more Connections attached
to them after they were created.

without having to first register any Endpoints.  When a Connection is established, the endpoint spec

Whether or not to delete any Endpoints created by a connection from this source if the connection is subsequently detached. this will not
remove Endpoints that have had more Connections attached to them after they were created.

Function to call when the user presses the mouse button to start a drag. This function is passed the original 
event and the element on which the associated makeSource call was made.  If it returns anything other than false,
the drag begins as usual. But if it returns false (the boolean false, not just something falsey), the drag is aborted.

scope to an Endpoint or Connection allows you to support different
types of Connections in the same UI.  If you're only interested in

will probably be used by very few people; it just instructs jsPlumb

classitems.description:
These are the default settings for jsPlumb.  They are what will be used if you do not supply specific pieces of information 
to the various API calls. A convenient way to implement your own look and feel can be to override these defaults 
by including a script somewhere after the jsPlumb include, but before you make any calls to jsPlumb.

classitems.description:
Register an event handler, optionally as a delegate for some set of descendant elements. Note
that this method takes either 3 or 4 arguments - if you supply 3 arguments it is assumed you have
omitted the `children` parameter, and that the event handler should be bound directly to the given element.

return.description: The current jsPlumb instance; you can chain this method.

classitems.description:
Cancel delegate event handling for the given function. Note that unlike with 'on' you do not supply
a list of child selectors here: it removes event delegation from all of the child selectors for which the
given function was registered (if any).

The hover paint style is applied as extensions to the paintStyle; it does not entirely replace

Clears either all listeners, or listeners for some specific event, or just some listener. You can call this method
with zero, one or two arguments: with zero arguments, all listeners are cleared. With one argument that is a string, all listeners for
the specified event type are cleared. With one argument that is a function, it is removed from the appropriate event list.
With two arguments, the first is an event type, and the second is a function to be unbound. In fact this is perhaps unnecessary
given that you can unbind a function just by passing it.

classitems.description:
Replaces values inside some JS object according to a given path spec. A path spec is a string in dotted notation,
with each component optionally declaring an array index. Some examples are:

foo.bar
